results.title: The Ancestry of science: the god within
results.brief_description: The influence that contributed to early Greek philosophy and the beginnings of science. Shows the early philosophers seeking to rationalise the world around them; three explanations of the creation of the universe; the foreshadowing of modern quantitative chemistry.
results.title_for_label: The Ancestry of science: the god within

results.title: God bless mummy and make her good
results.creator_credit: Sarah Erulkar, George Howe, ICEM and National Association for Maternal and Child Welfare
results.brief_description: The homes of ordinary families are visited in order to record the natural reactions of the parents and their children in their own environment, doing the things they do every day. Intended to provoke parents into thinking about their relationships with their children.

results.title: Goats
results.brief_description: This film shows life on an American goat farm; care of goats; milking, growth of two kids from birth to two months; use of goats for haulage.

results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.

results.title: Go, sober and safe
results.creator_credit: Earl Deems and Highway Safety Films
results.brief_description: More than 50% of all traffic deaths in the USA are caused by drinking drivers. How people are actually affected by alcohol depends very much on body weight, amount of food in the stomach and length of time over which the alcohol was consumed. Diagramatically the film explains how alcohol works and shows a test worked out to show how alcohol affects driving ability.

results.title: Go out and sell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
A commercial traveller with his foot in the door - or a merchandiser with a dump bin. What is the salesperson’s role in modern marketing? One of a series of films on modern marketing practices. The films explore the whole spectrum of activity including the salesperson’s role in selling and distribution. Presented by Christopher Chataway.

results.title: Glove puppetry - Scenery and production
results.brief_description: Final film in the series devoted to “Creative Leisure’. The children see the culmination of their work then they assemble scenery and puppets for the staging of their play. The children paint the backdrop and throne; gather leaves and stalks for scenery; and make baskets, fishing line, and table as props before staging their puppet play “Snow White and Rose Red.”

results.title: Glove puppetry - Painting and dressing
results.brief_description: Children paint and dress their own puppets at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre. The puppets being to come to life as colourful expressions are painted on, wigs added, and a strip of glue felted around the neck. Using a paper pattern, clothes are cut out, and then sewn strongly together.

results.title: Glove puppetry - making the heads
results.brief_description: Children make their own puppets to illustrate a story. After watching a play at the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre children learn how to mould puppet heads onto cardboard rolls with paper pulp. They use paper strips to add features, and finally leave them to dry on strands also made at the centre.

results.title: Gloucester Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.
results.description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.
